Highlights

  • Cognizant and Uniphore Announce Partnership to Deliver Domain-Specific AI for the Enterprise (Published 2026-02-02)

    Cognizant and Uniphore have joined forces to deliver smarter, domain-specific AI solutions that blend deep conversational AI capabilities with Cognizant’s broad system integration and consulting expertise. This alliance aims to provide industry-targeted automation, including AI-enabled contact centers, intelligent agents for enterprise workflows, and business process optimization.

    Strategically, the move signals the rise of deep, verticalized AI co-developed by GSIs and specialized firms rather than just relying on hyperscaler models. For the Workday ecosystem, it means intensifying demand for intelligent, natively embedded AI agents that closely connect to HR, finance, and operations processes. For Deloitte, clients will increasingly expect more than generic enterprise AI—they will seek domain-specific, process-aware automation closely tied to SaaS platforms. Source

  • Linq Secures $20M to Enable Embedded AI Assistants Within Enterprise Messaging (Published 2026-02-02)

    Linq’s $20M funding round will accelerate the deployment of native AI agents embedded in workplace messaging tools like Slack and Teams. The platform lets companies implement persistent, customizable AI personas that operate inside chat environments, directly supporting HR workflows, knowledge retrieval, approvals, and more.

    This approach exemplifies the shift toward agentic, context-aware AI that delivers real-time support and automation in the flow of work, challenging HR and SaaS vendors to enable seamless integrations. For Deloitte’s Workday-centered practice, the lesson is clear: client demand will increasingly center on intelligent workflow capabilities embedded in messaging ecosystems, demanding open APIs and rapid integration blueprints. Source

Competitive Watch

  • Cognizant & Uniphore: Announced a partnership to deliver industry-specific conversational and generative AI, targeting automation and engagement in enterprise settings.
    Implication: Cognizant strengthens its positioning with verticalized AI, raising stakes for SaaS vendors like Workday to deepen their ecosystem’s contextual AI capabilities. Deloitte’s Workday teams must anticipate client demand for pre-built, industry-specific agentic accelerators and seamless integration options.
  • Linq: Secured funding to further AI agent development for seamless operation inside enterprise messaging platforms.
    Implication: This reinforces a major usability trend—expectations for agentic AI to surface directly within chat and collaboration tools. Workday offerings must evolve to become actionable within these environments, or risk disintermediation by flexible agentic middleware.

Enablement

  • Responsible AI Governance—Frameworks for SaaS and HR Technology: Deepen your knowledge using Workday’s AI Masterclass. Outcome: Integrate responsible AI tools and regulatory considerations into every transformation engagement.
  • Latest Applications and Benefits of AI in HR: Review Workday’s latest guidance on embedded AI in HR. Outcome: Communicate the value of Workday’s native AI and automation story in client conversations and RFPs.
  • Agentic AI in the Modern Enterprise: Study Deloitte’s primer on agentic AI enablement. Outcome: Advise clients on current and future-state architectures and the governance of AI agent adoption in HR, payroll, and operations.

Actions for Next Week

  • Benchmark recent GSI and ISV AI partnerships for inclusion in competitive and market analysis.
  • Evaluate client deployments for potential integration points with messaging-based agentic AI frameworks.
  • Update client education resources to reflect the newest responsible AI governance recommendations from Workday and Deloitte.
  • Engage with technology and client teams on readiness for agent-based interfaces in HR and finance.

Risks & Mitigations

  • Risk: Competitors’ rapid advances in agentic AI may erode Workday’s differentiation.
    Mitigation: Prioritize ecosystem integration, rapid prototyping, and monitoring GSI/ISV partnership innovation.
  • Risk: Gaps in AI governance and regulation could create compliance and reputational risks for clients.
    Mitigation: Institutionalize responsible AI governance frameworks in every advisory and transformation engagement.

All Sources

  • Cognizant and Uniphore Partner to Deliver Smarter, Domain-Specific AI for the Enterprise
  • Linq raises $20M to enable AI assistants to live within messaging apps
  • Responsible AI Governance | Workday AI Masterclass | Workday US
  • AI in HR: Applications, Benefits, and Examples | Workday US | Workday CA
  • L'IA agentique | Deloitte Canada

Return JSON ONLY in this exact shape (no code fences, no extra text):

{
  "type": "daily or weekly",
  "run_date": "YYYY-MM-DD",
  "title": "Short headline",
  "priority_focus": "1–2 sentences on what matters most now",
  "highlights": [
    { "headline": "…", "why_it_matters": "…", "source_url": "https://…" }
  ],
  "competitive_watch": [
    { "competitor": "Name", "move": "…", "implication": "…" }
  ],
  "enablement": [
    { "skill": "Topic", "resource_url": "https://…", "90_day_outcome": "…" }
  ],
  "actions_next_week": ["…"],
  "risks": [
    { "risk": "…", "mitigation": "…" }
  ],
  "sources": [
    { "title": "…", "url": "https://…" }
  ],
  "html_body": "<h2>…</h2> (well-formatted HTML with <a href="https://…">links</a>; no scripts/external CSS)",
  "plain_text_body": "Text-only with visible URLs"
}

Parameters:
- Set "run_date" to TODAY_ET = 2026-02-03.
- For DAILY: set "type":"daily"; target ~1000 words; STRICTLY restrict to the last 24 hours (from 2026-02-02T06:56 to 2026-02-03T06:56); include publication dates in highlight text.
- For WEEKLY: set "type":"weekly"; target 2000–2500 words; restrict to 2026-01-27…2026-02-03; include <h3>What changed this week</h3> and publication dates in highlight text.
- Section order for html_body: Highlights; Competitive Watch; Enablement; Actions for Next Week; Risks & Mitigations; All Sources.
- Every item must include at least one absolute URL (https://…).
- Keep total HTML under ~25KB.

ADDITIONAL REQUIREMENTS
- For every highlight and competitive_watch item, include a 2–3 paragraph detailed summary within the "why_it_matters" text.
- Where relevant, compare perspectives across multiple sources.
- Include a clear "so what" statement for Deloitte’s Workday practice.
- Ensure all cited URLs appear in the `sources` array and inside the `html_body` link text.
- Keep factual accuracy and avoid speculation.

may erode Workday’s differentiation.<br><strong>Mitigation:</strong> Prioritize ecosystem integration, rapid prototyping, and monitoring GSI/ISV partnership innovation.</li>\\n  <li><strong>Risk:</strong> Gaps in AI governance and regulation could create compliance and reputational risks for clients.<br><strong>Mitigation:</strong> Institutionalize responsible AI governance frameworks in every advisory and transformation engagement.</li>\\n</ul>\\n\\n<h2>All Sources</h2>\\n<ul>\\n  <li><a href=\\\"https://news.cognizant.com/2026-02-02-Cognizant-and-Uniphore-Partner-to-Deliver-Smarter,-Domain-Specific-AI-for-the-Enterprise\\\">Cognizant and Uniphore Partner to Deliver Smarter, enable AI assistants to live within messaging apps</a></li>\\n  <li><a href=\\\"https://www.workday.com/en-us/artificial-intelligence/ai-masterclass/responsible-ai-governance.html\\\">Responsible AI \"Highlights\\n- Cognizant and Uniphore Announce Partnership to Deliver Domain-Specific AI for the Enterprise (Published 2026-02-02)\\n  Cognizant and Uniphore have joined forces to offer smarter, domain-specific AI targeting enterprise needs in conversational and generative AI, bringing together system integration strength and deep automation technology. This marks a new phase where GSIs move beyond commodity AI and drive highly contextualized automation. The implications for Workday and its partners are profound—a signal that clients will soon expect agentic, verticalized solutions within core HR and finance processes. Read more: https://news.cognizant.com/2026-02-02-Cognizant-and-Uniphore-Partner-to-Deliver-Smarter,-Domain-Specific-AI-for-the-Enterprise\\n\\n- Linq Secures $20M to Enable Embedded AI Assistants Within Enterprise Messaging (Published 2026-02-02)\\n  Linq’s $20 million raise is aimed at advancing AI agent capabilities right inside workplace chat apps like Slack and Teams. Linq agents remember context and perform complex actions natively in messaging tools, pushing the boundary of what’s possible for distributed and real-time work. For Workday, this trend underscores the urgency to support embedded, messaging-based automation of HR and workflow tasks. Details: https://techcrunch.com/2026/02/02/linq-raises-20m-to-enable-ai-assistants-to-live-within-messaging-apps\\n\\nCompetitive Watch\\n- Cognizant & Uniphore: Their new partnership is laser-focused on industry-specific conversational and generative AI, directly threatening the traditional SaaS workflow paradigms of platforms like Workday. Clients will prioritize GSIs who bring both technical and process/vertical depth.\\n- Linq: With fresh funding, Linq is shaping the expectation that workflow automation should live directly inside team messaging and collaboration tools. Workday and consulting partners must be ready to plug their solutions into these environments.\\n\\nEnablement\\n- Responsible AI Governance—Frameworks for SaaS and HR Technology: Use Workday’s official AI Masterclass at https://www.workday.com/en-us/artificial-intelligence/ai-masterclass/responsible-ai-governance.html to strengthen your responsible AI approach in all transformation work.\\n- Latest Applications and Benefits of AI in HR: Update your solution and sales toolkits using insights from Workday’s AI in HR hub: https://www.workday.com/en-ca/topics/ai/ai-in-hr.html\\n- Agentic AI in the Modern Enterprise: Explore Deloitte’s primer for best practices and risks around agentic AI: https://www.deloitte.com/ca/fr/services/consulting/services/agentic-ai\\n\\nActions for Next Week\\n- Benchmark emergent GSI/ISV partnerships for their relevance to Workday digital transformation.\\n- Review current client deployments for messaging-agentic AI integration potential.\\n- Refresh client-facing content on responsible AI governance with latest Workday/Deloitte resources.\\n- Engage clients on readiness and strategy for embedded, agentic AI interfaces in HR/finance.\\n\\nRisks & Mitigations\\n- Risk: Competitor acceleration in agentic AI could narrow Workday’s lead. Mitigation: Ramp up ecosystem integration and agentic workflow prototyping.\\n- Risk: Rushed AI deployments could result in governance gaps.       "url": "https://auth0.com/changelog",
      "title": "Auth0 Changelog",
      "content": "Copied to clipboard\n\nWe are thrilled to announce a major milestone: the General Availability (GA) of Auth0 for AI Agents!\n\nAuth0 for AI Agents is a suite of features to empower developers to build secure agentic applications and experiences. The solution suite includes updates to: Token Vault for secure token based access to third-party APIs and applications; and Asynchronous Authorization for user approvals to keep the human in the loop for sensitive agent actions.\n\nHere are some highlights of the latest updates to the solution suite: [...] Connecting AI Agents and Third Party Apps in an enterprise introduces two key challenges: poor IT visibility into data sharing and repetitive user consent flows. Cross App Access (XAA) solves this by enabling IT teams to centralize control over these connections, eliminating constant user consent prompts and providing better governance and visibility into data sharing.\n\nThis new feature provides built-in support for SaaS providers to get their APIs ready for secure connection by AI Agents and other SaaS Apps in enterprise environments. No code changes needed, simply configure the feature in your Auth0 tenant to instantly support central policy enforcement and a seamless user experience.\n\nThis Beta release is for testing purposes only.\n\nTo learn more, read our documentation. [...] # Auth for MCP: Now in Early Access\n\nCopied to clipboard\n\nAuth0 is thrilled to announce that Auth for MCP is officially in Early Access! [...] Balancing autonomy with control: Organizations must also decide how much autonomy an AI agent should have. While some tasks can be fully automated, others—such as those involving financial analysis, healthcare recommendations or sensitive customer interactions—benefit from human-in-the-loop checkpoints. Determining where agents operate independently and where humans intervene is key to building intelligent systems that are both efficient and trustworthy. Finding the right balance of human intervention ensures safety without sacrificing efficiency.",

      "title": "Manually installing SSM Agent on Oracle Linux instances",
      "content": "Connect to your Oracle Linux instance using your preferred method,\nsuch as SSH.\n\nCopy the following command and run it on the instance.\n\n###### Note\n\nEven though URL in the following command includes an\n`ec2-downloads-windows` directory, these\nare the correct global installation files for Oracle Linux.\n\n`ec2-downloads-windows`\n`sudo yum install -y \n\n(Recommended) Run the following command to verify that the agent\nis running.\n\n`sudo systemctl status amazon-ssm-agent`\n\nIn most cases, the command reports that the agent is running, as\nshown in the following example.\n\nIn rare cases, the command reports that the agent is installed but\nnot running, as shown in the following example.\n\nTo activate the agent in these cases, run the following\ncommands. [...] If you've got a moment, please tell us how we can make the documentation better.       "url": "https://docs.aws.amazon.com/systems-manager/latest/userguide/automation-actions.html",
      "title": "Systems Manager Automation actions reference",
      "content": "Type: String\n\nRequired: Yes\n\nThe number of times the step should be retried in case of failure. If the\nvalue is greater than 1, the step isn't considered to have failed until all\nretry attempts have failed. The default value is 1.\n\nType: Integer\n\nRequired: No\n\nThe timeout value for the step. If the timeout is reached and the value of\n`maxAttempts` is greater than 1, then the step\nisn't considered to have timed out until all retries have been\nattempted.\n\n`maxAttempts`\n\nType: Integer\n\nRequired: No\n\nIndicates whether the automation should stop, continue, or go to a\ndifferent step on failure. The default value for this option is\nabort.\n\nType: String\n\nValid values: Abort | Continue |\nstep:`step_name`\n\n`step_name`\n\nRequired: No [...] Warning Javascript is disabled or is unavailable in your browser.\n\nWarning\n\nTo use the Amazon Web Services Documentation, Javascript must be enabled.     {
      "url": "https://docs.aws.amazon.com/systems-manager/latest/userguide/manually-install-ssm-agent-linux.html",
      "title": "Manually installing and uninstalling SSM Agent on EC2 ...",
      "content": "###### Choose your operating system\n\nTo view the procedure for manually installing SSM Agent on the specified operating system, choose a link from the following list:\n\n###### Note\n\nFor a list of supported versions of each of the following operating systems, see Supported operating systems for Systems Manager.\n\n AlmaLinux\n Amazon Linux 2 and Amazon Linux 2023\n Debian Server\n Oracle Linux\n Red Hat Enterprise Linux\n Rocky Linux\n Ubuntu Server\n\n## Uninstalling SSM Agent from Linux instances\n\nUse the package manager for your operating system to uninstall SSM Agent from Linux instances. Depending on the operating system, the uninstall command will be similar to the following example command:\n\n```\nsudo dpkg -r amazon-ssm-agent\n```\n\nDocument Conventions\n\nVerifying the signature of SSM Agent [...] Manually installing and uninstalling SSM Agent on EC2 instances for Linux - AWS Systems Manager\n\nDocumentationAWS Systems ManagerUser Guide\n\nUninstalling SSM Agent from Linux instances\n\nAWS Systems Manager Change Manager is no longer open to new customers. Existing customers can continue to use the service as normal. For more information, see AWS Systems Manager Change Manager availability change.\n\n# Manually installing and uninstalling SSM Agent on EC2 instances for Linux\n\nBefore you manually install AWS Systems Manager Agent (SSM Agent) on an Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud (Amazon EC2) Linux operating system, review the following information.\n\n###### Installation on other machine types [...] ###### Amazon Machine Images with the agent preinstalled\n\nSSM Agent is preinstalled on some Amazon Machine Images (AMIs) provided by AWS. Failing to use the latest version of the agent can prevent your managed node from using various Systems Manager tools and features. For that reason, we recommend that you automate the process of keeping SSM Agent up to date on your machines. For information, see Automating updates to SSM Agent.     {
      "url": "https://docs.aws.amazon.com/systems-manager/latest/userguide/ssm-agent-technical-details.html",
      "title": "Learn technical details about the SSM Agent",
      "content": "## Keeping SSM Agent up-to-date\n\nAn updated version of SSM Agent is released whenever new tools are added to Systems Manager or updates are made to existing tools. Failing to use the latest version of the agent can prevent your managed node from using various Systems Manager tools and features. For that reason, we recommend that you automate the process of keeping SSM Agent up to date on your machines. For information, see Automating updates to SSM Agent. Subscribe to the SSM Agent Release Notes page on GitHub to get notifications about SSM Agent updates.\n\n###### Note [...] The agent computes the hardware hash and fingerprint when the machine is registered for use with Systems Manager. Then, the fingerprint is passed back to the Systems Manager service when the agent sends a `RegisterManagedInstance` command.\n\nLater, when sending a `RequestManagedInstanceRoleToken` command, the agent checks the fingerprint and hardware hash in the Vault to make sure that the current machine attributes match with the stored hardware hash. If the current machine attributes do match the hardware hash stored in the Vault, the agent passes in the fingerprint from the Vault to `RegisterManagedInstance`, resulting in a successful call. [...] ###### Hibernation communication behavior\n\nWhen SSM Agent enters hibernation mode, its communication pattern with the Systems Manager service changes:\n\n Normal operation: The agent regularly communicates with Systems Manager (typically every few minutes) to check for new commands and report status.\n Hibernation mode: The ping frequency starts at 5 minutes and gradually increases to once per hour by default (configurable up to 24 hours). This reduced communication frequency helps minimize unnecessary network traffic while still allowing the agent to potentially recover if conditions change.",
      "score": 0.02869897,
      "raw_content": null

    {
      "url": "https://docs.aws.amazon.com/systems-manager/latest/userguide/using-service-linked-roles.html",
      "title": "Using service-linked roles for Systems Manager",
      "content": "A service-linked role makes setting up Systems Manager easier because you don’t have to manually add the necessary permissions. Systems Manager defines the permissions of its service-linked roles, and unless defined otherwise, only Systems Manager can assume its roles. The defined permissions include the trust policy and the permissions policy, and that permissions policy can't be attached to any other IAM entity.\n\nYou can delete a service-linked role only after first deleting their related resources. This protects your Systems Manager resources because you can't inadvertently remove permission to access the resources.\n\n###### Note [...] Document Conventions\n\nTroubleshooting\n\nInventory and Explorer data role\n\nDid this page help you? - Yes\n\nThanks for letting us know we're doing a good job!\n\nIf you've got a moment, please tell us what we did right so we can do more of it.\n\nDid this page help you? - No\n\nThanks for letting us know this page needs work.     {
      "url": "https://docs.aws.amazon.com/systems-manager/latest/userguide/documents-ssm-sharing.html",
      "title": "Sharing SSM documents - AWS Systems Manager",
      "content": "Use the interpolation parameter to improve security\n:   For `String` type parameters in your SSM documents, use the parameter and value `interpolationType\": \"ENV_VAR` to improve security against command injection attacks by treating parameter inputs as string literals rather than potentially executable commands. In this case, the agent creates an environment variable named `SSM_parameter-name` with the parameter's value. We recommend updating all your existing SSM documents that include `String` type parameters to include `\"interpolationType\": \"ENV_VAR\"`. For more information, see Writing SSM document content.\n\n## Block public sharing for SSM documents [...] PowerShell\n:   ```\n    Get-SSMDocumentDescription ` –Name arn:aws:ssm:us-east-2:12345678912:document/documentName\n    ```\n\nTo run a shared SSM document\n\nLinux & macOS\n:   ```\n    aws ssm send-command \\ --document-name arn:aws:ssm:us-east-2:12345678912:document/documentName \\ --instance-ids ID\n    ```\n\nWindows\n:   ```\n    aws ssm send-command ^ --document-name arn:aws:ssm:us-east-2:12345678912:document/documentName ^ --instance-ids ID\n    ```\n\nPowerShell\n:   ```\n    Send-SSMCommand ` –DocumentName arn:aws:ssm:us-east-2:12345678912:document/documentName ` –InstanceIds ID\n    ```\n\nDocument Conventions\n\nRunning documents from remote locations\n\nSearching for SSM documents\n\nDid this page help you? - Yes\n\nThanks for letting us know we're doing a good job! [...] PowerShell\n   :   ```\n       Set-AWSCredentials –AccessKey your key –SecretKey your key Set-DefaultAWSRegion -Region region\n       ```\n2. Use the following command to list all of the SSM documents that are available for you. The list includes documents that you created and documents that were shared with you.\n\n   Linux & macOS\n   :   ```\n       aws ssm list-documents\n       ```\n\n   Windows\n   :   ```\n       aws ssm list-documents\n       ```\n\n   PowerShell\n   :   ```\n       Get-SSMDocumentList\n       ```\n3. Use the following command to get a specific document.\n\n   Linux & macOS\n   :   ```\n       aws ssm get-document \\ --name document name\n       ```\n\n   Windows\n   :   ```\n       aws ssm get-document ^ --name document name\n       ```",

      "url": "https://docs.aws.amazon.com/systems-manager/latest/userguide/ssm-agent-automatic-updates.html",
      "title": "Automating updates to SSM Agent - AWS Systems Manager",
      "content": "## Automatically updating SSM Agent\n\nYou can configure Systems Manager to automatically update SSM Agent on all Linux-based and Windows-based managed nodes in your AWS account. If you turn on this option, then Systems Manager automatically checks every two weeks for a new version of the agent. If there is a new version, then Systems Manager automatically updates the agent to the latest released version using the SSM document `AWS-UpdateSSMAgent`. We encourage you to choose this option to ensure that your managed nodes are always running the most up-to-date version of SSM Agent.\n\n###### Note [...] Automating updates to SSM Agent - AWS Systems Manager\n\nDocumentationAWS Systems ManagerUser Guide\n\nAutomatically updating SSM Agent\n\nAWS Systems Manager Change Manager is no longer open to new customers. Existing customers can continue to use the service as normal. For more information, see AWS Systems Manager Change Manager availability change.\n\n# Automating updates to SSM Agent\n\nAWS releases a new version of AWS Systems Manager Agent (SSM Agent) when we add or update Systems Manager tools. If your managed nodes use an older version of the agent, then you can't use the new tools or benefit from the updated tools. For these reasons, we recommend that you automate the process of updating SSM Agent on your managed nodes using any of the following methods. [...] If you prefer to update SSM Agent on your managed nodes manually, you can subscribe to notifications that AWS publishes when a new version of the agent is released. For information, see Subscribing to SSM Agent notifications. After you subscribe to notifications, you can use Run Command to manually update one or more managed nodes with the latest version. For more information, see Updating the SSM Agent using Run Command.\n\n## Automatically updating SSM Agent",

With the ADP Vantage HCM® integration, your team can begin offering EWA in as little as one hour.\nWhen the workday ends, Immediate's AI compares employee shift history with new work log items to verify time worked. Team members then have access to their earned but not yet paid wages through the ImmediatePay app. The integration with ADP Vantage HCM® allows Immediate to see real-time data and provide an automatic deduction file for the next pay period.       "content": "Dayforce HCM is a cloud solution for Payroll, Benefits, Workforce Management, Human Resources, Talent Management, Document Management, and Analytics. Built on a single database with one rule engine, Dayforce HCM enables organizations to find and hire the right people, process pay, manage benefits enrollment, maintain HR records, and schedule staff while monitoring compliance throughout the employee lifecycle. Predictive Analytics allows flight-risk data to be embedded throughout the application for easy access and at no additional cost. This new capability applies machine learning algorithms to employee data, giving managers and executives a new tool to evaluate employee flight risk and identify and address reasons contributing to employee turnover. [...] “Flight risk data is updated on a daily basis, allowing managers to make real-time calculations and act quickly to retain top talent,” said Deb LaMere, Vice President, Employee Experience, Ceridian. “It also helps identify trends within the entire organization so retention issues can more accurately be managed at the executive level.”",

[...] “Dayforce HCM has consistently ranked as the leading Leader in our Human Capital Management Value Matrix,” says Brent Skinner, Principal Analyst at Nucleus Research. “This is thanks to Ceridian’s commitment to innovation as they bring full HCM into a single application, with a single dataset governed by a single rules engine. The addition of Predictive Analytics will give Dayforce users the ability to unlock the power of that single dataset for all of HCM. This is where Human Resource Service Delivery (HRSD) plays a crucial role.\n\nHRSD helps organizations modernize HR operations by delivering employee services through a single, unified platform.\n\n## What is Human Resource Service Delivery (HRSD)?\n\nHuman Resource Service Delivery (HRSD) is a structured approach to delivering HR services efficiently using automation, workflows, and self-service capabilities.\n\nWith ServiceNow HRSD, employees can: [...] With ServiceNow HRSD, employees can:\n\n Submit HR requests\n Access HR knowledge articles\n Track request status\n Communicate with HR teams\n\nInstead of employees searching for the right HR contact, HRSD provides one central channel for all HR-related needs.\n\n## Why HRSD is Important for Organizations\n\nHRSD directly impacts both employee experience and business productivity.\n\nKey benefits include:\n\n Improved employee engagement\n Faster HR case resolution\n Reduced manual effort for HR teams\n Better collaboration across HR, IT, Finance, and Facilities\n Consistent and compliant HR service delivery\n\nWhen HR services are simple and reliable, employees spend less time following up and more time focusing on their core responsibilities.\n\n## Real-Life HRSD Use Case\n\nPayroll Query Example [...] 4 weeks ago\n\nTo be honest   @GlideFather ,\n\nI didn't know that image is already exists in that blog .\n\nbut thank you for your info , I will make sure this thing not happening again in future..\n\nThank you.\n\n0  Helpfuls\n\nReply\n\nRelated Content\n\n Resolve HR case flow via Agentic AI: Overview in HRSD articles\n Resolve HR Case flow via Agentic AI - Configuration and Implementation Guide in HRSD articles\n Resolve HR Case flow via Agentic AI - Leading Practice in HRSD articles\n HR tasks in my todos page in esc in HRSD forum",

      "title": "Principal Advisor, ServiceNow Employee Experience and HR Service Delivery (HRSD) Solutions , Seattle | ServiceNow Careers",
      "content": "# Principal Advisor, ServiceNow Employee Experience and HR Service Delivery (HRSD) Solutions. Role description: Principal Advisor, ServiceNow Employee Experience and HR Service Delivery (HRSD) Solutions. This role is a functional and technical expert consulting with corporations on their digital transformation journey powered by implementing ServiceNow’s Employee Service Management Solutions, which includes HR Service Delivery (HRSD), and Workplace/Facility Service Delivery (WSD) solutions. This Advisor role will be the SME within ServiceNow Expert Services (who provide product expertise, in partnership with ServiceNow Product Management), providing expert advisory and building strong executive client relationships within the framework of a strategic program or project with ServiceNow implementing these solutions. * Serve as primary executive point-of-contact on projects, focused on improvements in the client’s Human Resources and Workplace organizations using ServiceNow’s Employee Service Management, HRSD, and WSD Solutions. * Understand customer requirements in collaboration with ServiceNow Expert Services and align them with ServiceNow Expert Services, Product Excellence, Customer Success, and Client Sales Teams to drive high-value impact for the Client in a roadmap for the current engagement, and the Client’s roadmap beyond it. * Align Client to defined roadmap and report/monitor ongoing progress against it, managing client executives and stakeholders – in partnership with ServiceNow Expert Services – to mitigate blockers to drive success, keeping the in-progress engagement on track. * Define, at a solution and design level of detail, technical and functional solutions aligned with our client’s business problems and ServiceNow Implementation Best Practices, providing options with pros, cons, and risks. * Build and nurture strong, trusted advisory relationships with client executives and stakeholders in the client’s Human Resources and Workplace organizations, facilitating effective communication and collaboration between their corporation and ServiceNow. * Advocate for the continuous improvement and adoption of ServiceNow Employee Service Management and HR Service Delivery (HRSD) Solutions. * 10+ years of management consulting experience or equivalent role repeatedly championing/implementing ServiceNow HR Service Delivery (HRSD) with various organizations. Learn more here.\n\n### Go deeper with community scenarios [...] Communities power learning, dialogue, and engagement across the organization. They enable modern, two‑way communication between leaders and employees and help build trust at scale. With communities in Teams, these connections now happen where people already collaborate, making communication more accessible and impactful.\n\nThis integration unifies all conversation spaces in Teams—from rapid 1:1 and group chats, to collaborative project channels, to open communities that support broad connection and shared learning across the organization. By bringing these experiences together, we’re unlocking all-in-one value for every employee: deeper context, richer conversations, and a more connected workday.\n\n### Bring your organization together in Teams [...] ### Bring your organization together in Teams\n\nBelow are the top new capabilities, each designed to meet people where they work while supporting the full spectrum of organizational connection and communication.\n\n## A modern community layout in Teams\n\nWe've designed communities in Teams so that it feels native to the overall Teams experience, including a larger conversation pane, a docked right rail, and Teams-style unread indicators both in the feed and left navigation. Communities now appear in the default unified Chat app in Teams, right alongside chats and channels, so they’re visible and reachable throughout the workday. It’s easier than ever to scroll your feed, react, comment, and create posts, with the same familiarity as engaging on Engage web or app.",

      "url": "https://aws.amazon.com/blogs/aws/introducing-multi-agent-collaboration-capability-for-amazon-bedrock",
      "title": "Introducing multi-agent collaboration capability for Amazon Bedrock (preview) | AWS News Blog",
      "content": "Amazon Bedrock Agents manages the collaboration, communication, and task delegation behind the scenes. By enabling agents to work together, you can achieve higher task success rates, accuracy, and enhanced productivity. In internal benchmark testing, multi-agent collaboration has shown marked improvements compared to single-agent systems for handling complex, multi-step tasks. [...] With the fully managed multi-agent collaboration capability on Amazon Bedrock, specialized agents work within their domains of expertise, coordinated by a supervisor agent. The supervisor breaks down requests, delegates tasks, and consolidates outputs into a final response. For example, an investment advisory multi-agent system might include agents specialized in financial data analysis, research, forecasting, and investment recommendations. Similarly, a retail operations multi-agent system could handle demand forecasting, inventory allocation, supply chain coordination, and pricing optimization. [...] In Supervisor mode, the supervisor agent analyzes the input, breaking down complex problems or paraphrasing the request. It then invokes subagents either serially or in parallel, and it might consult knowledge bases or invoke action groups. After receiving responses from subagents, the supervisor agent processes them to determine if the problem is solved or if further action is needed.",

      "url": "https://aws.amazon.com/about-aws/whats-new/2025/03/amazon-bedrock-multi-agent-collaboration/",
      "title": "Amazon Bedrock now supports multi-agent collaboration - AWS",
      "content": "Search\n\n# Amazon Bedrock now supports multi-agent collaboration\n\nToday, AWS announces the general availability (GA) of multi-agent collaboration for Amazon Bedrock, allowing developers to create networks of specialized agents that communicate and coordinate under the guidance of a supervisor agent. This new capability allows you to tackle more intricate, multi-step workflows and scale your AI-driven applications more effectively. [...] Amazon Bedrock multi-agent collaboration GA introduces key enhancements designed to improve scalability, flexibility, and operational efficiency. Inline Agents allow you to dynamically adjust agent roles and behaviors at runtime, making workflows more adaptable as your business needs evolve. With Payload Referencing, supervisor agents can reference linked data instead of embedding it in every request, reducing data transfer, improving response times, and lowering operational costs. Additionally, multi-agent now offers CloudFormation (CFN) and Cloud Development Kit (CDK) support so you can create reusable teams of agents as templates that can be shared across accounts within an organization. [...] This release also introduces agent monitoring and observability features, helping you track, monitor, and optimize agent interactions more efficiently. These features improve debugging and traceability, ensuring better visibility into agent workflows and making troubleshooting easier for developers.\n\nMulti-agent collaboration on Amazon Bedrock is now available in all AWS Regions where Amazon Bedrock is supported. To learn more about this feature and how it can help you build more sophisticated AI applications, see the Amazon Bedrock product page or refer to the documentation for detailed information on getting started.\n\n## Learn\n\n## Resources\n\n## Developers\n\n## Help",

      "content": "“Using multi-agent collaboration in Amazon Bedrock, customers can get more accurate results by creating and assigning specialized agents for specific steps of a project and accelerate tasks by orchestrating multiple agents working in parallel,” AWS said.\n\nCustomers build their specialized agents on Bedrock, and then make a supervisor or orchestrator agent to help manage the other agents. AWS said the supervisor agent “handles the coordination, like breaking up and routing tasks to the right agents, giving specific agents access to the information they need to complete their work and determining what actions can be processed in parallel.” [...] AWS first introduced agentic capabilities in 2023 with the release of Agents on Bedrock, which offered enterprises a way to start building agents.     {
      "url": "https://investor.workday.com/2025-11-19-Workday-Expands-Its-Open-Ecosystem-with-New-Global-Developer-Network-and-Google-BigQuery-Partnership",
      "title": "Workday Expands Its Open Ecosystem with New Global Developer Network and Google BigQuery Partnership - Nov 19, 2025",
      "content": "# Workday Expands Its Open Ecosystem with New Global Developer Network and Google BigQuery Partnership. *Google BigQuery Becomes the Newest Workday Data Cloud Partner, Offering Secure, Zero-Copy Access to Trusted HR and Finance Data*. (NASDAQ: WDAY), the enterprise AI platform for managing people, money, and agents, today introduced a new global developer network that opens access to Workday AI tools and training, helping people around the world learn, build, and certify new skills. The company also announced Google Cloud as the newest partner to join Workday Data Cloud, giving customers a secure, zero-copy way to bring Workday HR and finance data to BigQuery for AI-powered insights. \"With the launch of our global developer network and Google BigQuery joining Workday Data Cloud, we're opening our ecosystem in ways that meaningfully expand what's possible for customers,\" said Gerrit Kazmaier, president of product and technology, Workday. \"When more people can access Workday's trusted data, tools, and AI, organizations can move faster, unlock new insights, and drive real business results.\". To grow the next wave of AI talent, Workday is launching a global developer network that opens access to Workday Build, giving a broader community of learners the opportunity to develop, certify, and apply Workday skills. **Google BigQuery Joins Workday Data Cloud**. Through the partnership, customers will get direct, zero-copy access to their Workday HR and finance data within Google Cloud, including BigQuery and BigLake. Customers will also be able to bring insights generated in Google Cloud, including AI-driven predictions like customer churn risk, back into Workday to inform decisions and drive better outcomes. Google Cloud joins ecosystem partners Databricks, Salesforce, and Snowflake to give customers even more ways to securely combine Workday's data with the tools they already use. \"Connecting the Workday Data Cloud with BigQuery and our market-leading Gemini models will give customers faster, more flexible access to critical business data,\" said Andi Gutmans, VP and GM, Data Cloud, Google Cloud. \"By combining Workday's trusted HR and finance data with Google Cloud's leading analytics and AI capabilities, customers can build intelligent agents to streamline their operations and drive smarter and more timely decisions with confidence.\".",
      "score": 0.8775715,

      "url": "https://cloud.google.com/blog/products/ai-machine-learning/workday-uses-google-cloud-ai-to-accelerate-document-processing",
      "title": "Workday uses Google Cloud AI to accelerate document processing | Google Cloud Blog",
      "content": "# Going global: Workday uses Google Cloud AI to accelerate document processing. Workday, with more than 3,400 core Workday Financial Management and Workday HCM customers, offers the Workday Expenses solution to provide a frictionless expense reporting experience for their customers. Here's how they did it using Google Cloud's Procurement DocAI. Workday provides enterprise cloud applications for finance and human resources. Their in-house expense receipt parsing functionality needed to scale for international customers in multiple languages. Workday leverages Google Cloud’s Procurement DocAI machine learning solution to automate the processing of receipts with multi-language support as a key component of its expense receipt scanning capability. This partnership delivers data capture at scale, enabling Workday customers to gain deeper insights (e.g., fraud detection) and find new opportunities to keep their businesses moving forward. Google Cloud’s Procurement DocAI, combined with our document processing machine learning models, enables streamlined receipt intake for our customers at global scale.”* - **Shane Luke, VP Machine Learning & AI, Workday**. Incorporating Procurement DocAI’s multi-language support into Workday applications means faster innovation for customers to support their global deployments. Expanding languages to include French, German, and Spanish enables Workday to extend the reach of its solution to serve more customers around the world. Additional support in Workday for other languages and more documents like supplier invoices is in the near future. The partnership between Google Cloud and Workday is just one of the latest examples of how we’re providing AI-powered solutions to solve business problems. **Procurement DocAI accelerates critical document processing**. Procurement DocAI is built on the recently announced Document AI platform, a unified console for document processing. All of Google Cloud’s specialized parsers are fine-tuned to achieve industry-leading accuracy, helping customers and partners confidently unlock insights from documents with machine learning. To learn more about how to get started with Procurement DocAI to automate your document workflows, check out this step-by-step guide. ##### Using Document AI to automate procurement workflows.       "url": "https://docs.cloud.google.com/chronicle/docs/reference/sample-yaral-for-native-dashboard",
      "title": "Sample YARA-L 2.0 queries for Dashboards",
      "content": "Google Cloud Documentation\n\nGoogle Cloud Documentation\n\n# Sample YARA-L 2.0 queries for Dashboards\n\nThis document provides a library of YARA-L 2.0 query examples for common dashboard use cases. These examples are organized by data source to help you visualize security telemetry, track analyst workflows, and measure the effectiveness of your automated response playbooks. For more information about dashboards, see Dashboards overview.\n\nBy using these queries, you can transform raw event and case data into high-level metrics, such as:\n\nFor more information about building and customizing your visual interface, see the Dashboards overview.\n\n## Data sources supported [...] `$Log_Type = ingestion.log_type\nmatch:\n$Log_Type\noutcome:\n$Total_Size_Bytes = sum(if(ingestion.component = \"Ingestion API\", ingestion.log_volume, 0))\n$Total_Logs = sum(if(ingestion.component = \"Ingestion API\", ingestion.log_count, 0))\n$Total_Normalized_Events = sum(if(ingestion.component = \"Normalizer\" AND ingestion.state = \"validated\", ingestion.event_count, 0))\n$Total_Parsing_Error_Events = sum(if(ingestion.component = \"Normalizer\" AND ingestion.state = \"failed_parsing\", ingestion.log_count, 0))\n$Total_Validation_Error_Events = sum(if(ingestion.component = \"Normalizer\" AND ingestion.state = \"failed_validation\", ingestion.event_count, 0))\n$Total_Indexing_Error_Events = sum(if(ingestion.component = \"Normalizer\" AND ingestion.state = \"failed_indexing\", ingestion.log_count, 0))\norder: [...] #### Top 10 detections\n\nThe following example provides a breakdown of the most frequent detections across major cloud providers (Google Cloud, Amazon Web Services (`AWS`), Microsoft Azure (`AZURE`)), limited to the top 10 most active rules:\n\n`AWS`\n`AZURE`\n`$log_type = detection.collection_elements.references.event.metadata.log_type\n$log_type = /GCP|AWS|AZURE/\n$rule_name = detection.detection.rule_name\n$rule_name != \"\"\nmatch:\n$rule_name\noutcome:\n$event_count = count(detection.id)\norder:\n$event_count desc\nlimit:\n10`\n\n#### Detections over time by IoC type\n\nThe following example categorizes detections by their Indicator of Compromise (IoC) type, letting teams see which types of threats (for example, IP, Domain, Hash) are most prevalent:",

      "url": "https://www.deloitte.com/ce/en/industries/technology/analysis/ai-infrastructure-compute-strategy.html",
      "title": "AI inference is reshaping enterprise compute strategies",
      "content": "“The infrastructure many enterprises have today was designed for the pre-AI era. No one is that smart or lucky to have designed their architecture for something that didn’t exist at the time. Very quickly, most infrastructure capacity will be dedicated to AI systems rather than traditional workloads.”\n\nThis shift is accelerating the emergence of so-called “AI factories” – purpose-built environments that integrate AI-optimized hardware, high-performance networking, data pipelines and unified orchestration platforms. These environments are designed to support multimodal AI workloads efficiently, reduce architectural risk and enable faster deployment at scale.\n\nWorkforce transformation and sustainability come to the fore [...] Beyond cost pressures, enterprises must also navigate data sovereignty requirements, latency constraints, intellectual property protection and system resilience. According to Deloitte Insights, the answer is not a binary choice between cloud and on-premises infrastructure, but a more deliberate, workload-driven hybrid approach that aligns technical requirements with business priorities.\n\nOrganizations that act now to modernize infrastructure and build workforce capabilities are better positioned to shape the next phase of enterprise computing. Advances in specialized chipsets, high-speed networking and intelligent workload orchestration are becoming foundational to AI at scale.\n\nHybrid compute becomes a strategic imperative [...] © 2026. In addition to our Responsible AI program, which provides governance in defining procedures for the development and management of AI at Workday, we're committed to the belief that AI should:\n\n Amplify human potential\n Positively impact society\n Champion transparency and fairness\n Deliver on our commitment to data privacy and protection [...] For HR, AI has proven to be a decisive factor in enabling a streamlined recruiting process, personalized career development, and improved employee engagement—and that’s just the start. At Workday, we’ve been proactive in developing responsible AI, keeping human decision-makers in the loop and adhering to key ethical principles. In addition to our Responsible AI program, which provides governance in defining procedures for the development and management of AI at Workday, we're committed to the belief that AI should:\n\n Amplify human potential\n Positively impact society\n Champion transparency and fairness\n Deliver on our commitment to data privacy and protection [...] For HR, AI has proven to be a decisive factor in enabling a streamlined recruiting process, personalized career development, and improved employee engagement—and that’s just the start. According to Workday research, 80% of business leaders say that AI and ML help employees at their company work more efficiently and make better decisions. Before we explore those efficiencies in greater detail, let’s define some essential AI terms:\n\nArtificial intelligence refers to machines that can perform tasks typically seen as requiring human intelligence. By analyzing data, recognizing patterns, and making predictions at greater speed and scale, AI enhances human productivity.       "url": "https://www.workday.com/en-be/topics/ai/ai-in-hr.html",
      "title": "AI in HR: Applications, Benefits and Examples | Workday US | Workday BE",
      "content": "Our “AI IQ” report shows that only 29% of business leaders are very confident that AI is currently applied ethically. At Workday, we’ve been proactive in developing responsible AI, keeping human decision-makers in the loop and adhering to key ethical principles. In addition to our Responsible AI programme, which provides governance in defining procedures for the development and management of AI at Workday, we're committed to the belief that AI should:\n\n Amplify human potential\n Positively impact society\n Champion transparency and fairness\n Deliver on our commitment to data privacy and protection [...] For HR, AI has proven to be a decisive factor in enabling a streamlined recruiting process, personalised career development and improved employee engagement – and that’s just the start. According to Workday research, 80% of business leaders say that AI and ML help employees at their company work more efficiently and make better decisions. Before we explore those efficiencies in greater detail, let’s define some essential AI terms: [...] According to the Workday “AI IQ” global study, 99% of decision-makers believe investing in AI leads to business benefits. The main reasons include improved decision-making (41%), automated business processes (35%) and improved employee retention/experience (32%). Here are just a handful of the areas where AI is already pushing improved performance for HR:",
      "score": 0.9999895,
      "raw_content": null
    },
    {
      "url": "https://blog.workday.com/en-gb/how-responsible-ai-can-reshape-hr.html",
      "title": "04 - How responsible AI can reshape HR | Workday UK",
      "content": "Like Mondelēz, athletic shoe company On has been determining the optimal tasks for automation, says Julie Muggli, Head of Talent (HR) Operations, Technology and Analytics. “We’re identifying those gaps where we think AI could really serve us,” Muggli says. “For example, we’ve launched scheduling and time tracking with Workday, which has machine learning (ML) for forecasting and AI for the generation of schedules. On the recruiting side, we have AI with a note taker in the interview process, which is also a coach that can give guidance to the interviewer.” [...] In addition to taking into account employees’ wants and needs, new technologies need to be accessible to employees and meet them where they are. For industrial gases company Air Liquide, which has a mix of white-collar and blue-collar employees, placing self-service within reach of all employees was crucial, says Agnès Le Guern, HR Transformation Project Director, Air Liquide. “We offer all of our employees the same level of self-service, regardless if you are in the manufacturing environment or if you are office-based,” Le Guern says. [...] Automation frees up HR leaders for more high-touch tasks, ramping up both efficiency and efficacy. It also may make traditionally error-prone processes more seamless and successful for employees. Before Mondelēz launched its onboarding automation, about three-quarters of employees’ laptops and other devices did not arrive before their start date, resulting in lost productivity and, for employees, an unfortunate first impression of their new company. Now, with automation, over 90 percent of devices are delivered by employees’ first day on the job.",

      "url": "https://www.databricks.com/blog/infrastructure-strategies-driving-next-wave-enterprise-ai",
      "title": "Infrastructure & Strategies Driving the Next Wave of ...",
      "content": "Enterprises that have started this transition are treating agentic capabilities as catalysts for discipline. Workday, for example, focuses heavily on surfacing the right data to agents, validating the authority behind agent actions, and ensuring governance patterns are consistent at every layer. Their approach reinforces that responsible autonomy is achievable only when data strategy and AI strategy move together.\n\n3M offers another perspective. Their data and AI teams concentrate on building deeper metadata and business context before scaling agentic capabilities. By strengthening the semantic layer behind their data, they ensure that every model and agent has the clarity it needs to make dependable decisions. For them, context is not a technical detai, buta strategic asset. [...] As executives plan for the next decade of AI innovation, the real question is no longer whether AI will transform their business. It is whether their organization’s data, governance, and architectural foundations are prepared to support autonomy, action, and long-term performance.\n\n## Where to Go Deeper\n\nDownload the full MIT Technology Review for detailed insights into the practices that separate high-performing data and AI organizations from their peers.\n\nWatch the on-demand webinar: Unlocking the Future of Data and AI, to learn how leaders from 3M, Workday, Reckitt, and Databricks are aligning data, governance, and AI to deliver real outcomes.\n\nKeep up with us\n\nShare this post\n\n## Never miss a Databricks post\n\n## Sign up\n\n## What's next? [...] AI has advanced quickly, yet only a small group of enterprises are converting early wins into meaningful advantage. Most have proven that generative AI can boost productivity and accelerate workflows, but far fewer have built the foundations required to scale that impact across the business. The moment facing senior technology leaders is decisive. The differentiator is no longer progress alone, but whether data, governance, and architecture are mature enough to translate AI momentum into enterprise-wide performance.",

      "url": "https://www.cognizant.com/us/en/services/ai/artificial-intelligence-solutions",
      "title": "Artificial Intelligence (AI) Solutions",
      "content": "AI is ushering in a new age of productivity growth, human and robotic collaboration and, most importantly, the intuitiveness sought by consumers. Artificial intelligence pinpoints areas of opportunity and delivers personal insights that drive innovation. Whether a company is experiencing overall business growth, or seasonal or temporary growth, AI’s predictive and scalable platform allows businesses to respond quickly and smoothly to the needs of their customers and to changes in the market. AI is optimizing and modernizing companies and helping them rethink how they do business.\n\n## Why is AI so important? [...] ### AI solutions FAQ\n\n## What is artificial intelligence?\n\nArtificial intelligence (AI) is the area of computer science that focuses on simulating human intelligence. AI’s true meaning comes from combining rational, emotional and cognitive levels of intelligence across a larger process.\n\n## What are the business benefits of artificial intelligence?       "url": "https://www.databricks.com/blog/infrastructure-strategies-driving-next-wave-enterprise-ai",
      "title": "Infrastructure & Strategies Driving the Next Wave of ...",
      "content": "Enterprises that have started this transition are treating agentic capabilities as catalysts for discipline. Workday, for example, focuses heavily on surfacing the right data to agents, validating the authority behind agent actions, and ensuring governance patterns are consistent at every layer. Their approach reinforces that responsible autonomy is achievable only when data strategy and AI strategy move together.\n\n3M offers another perspective. Their data and AI teams concentrate on building deeper metadata and business context before scaling agentic capabilities. By strengthening the semantic layer behind their data, they ensure that every model and agent has the clarity it needs to make dependable decisions. For them, context is not a technical detai, buta strategic asset. [...] As executives plan for the next decade of AI innovation, the real question is no longer whether AI will transform their business. It is whether their organization’s data, governance, and architectural foundations are prepared to support autonomy, action, and long-term performance.\n\n## Where to Go Deeper\n\nDownload the full MIT Technology Review for detailed insights into the practices that separate high-performing data and AI organizations from their peers.\n\nWatch the on-demand webinar: Unlocking the Future of Data and AI, to learn how leaders from 3M, Workday, Reckitt, and Databricks are aligning data, governance, and AI to deliver real outcomes.\n\nKeep up with us\n\nShare this post\n\n## Never miss a Databricks post\n\n## Sign up\n\n## What's next? [...] AI has advanced quickly, yet only a small group of enterprises are converting early wins into meaningful advantage. Most have proven that generative AI can boost productivity and accelerate workflows, but far fewer have built the foundations required to scale that impact across the business. The moment facing senior technology leaders is decisive. The differentiator is no longer progress alone, but whether data, governance, and architecture are mature enough to translate AI momentum into enterprise-wide performance.",

These examples are organized by data source to help you visualize security telemetry, track analyst workflows, and measure the effectiveness of your automated response playbooks. For more information about dashboards, see Dashboards overview.\n\nBy using these queries, you can transform raw event and case data into high-level metrics, such as:\n\nFor more information about building and customizing your visual interface, see the Dashboards overview.\n\n## Data sources supported [...] ## Playbooks\n\nUse Playbooks to monitor your automated response capabilities with queries designed to identify faulted actions and track real-time playbook performance.\n\nThe following templates demonstrate how to query playbooks to visualize the efficiency, success rates, and environmental distribution of your automated response workflows:\n\n`Playbooks`\n`playbook`\n`playbook.display_name`\n\n### Schema reference [...] `principal`\n`security_result`\n\n| Field name (query ready) | Data type | Description |\n --- \n| `metadata.event_type` | Enum | Type of event (for example, `PROCESS_LAUNCH`, `USER_LOGIN`). |\n| `metadata.event_timestamp.seconds` | Integer | Epoch timestamp of the event in seconds. |\n| `metadata.product_name` | String | Name of the product that generated the log. |\n| `metadata.vendor_name` | String | Name of the product vendor. |\n| `principal.ip` | String | IP address of the acting entity. |\n| `principal.user.userid` | String | User ID of the acting entity. |\n| `target.ip` | String | IP address of the target entity. |\n| `network.sent_bytes` | Integer | Number of bytes sent. |\n| `security_result.action` | Enum | Action taken, such as `BLOCK` or `ALLOW`. |",

    {
      "url": "https://www.deloitte.com/uk/en/blogs/monday-briefing/is-ai-driving-unemployment.html",
      "title": "Is AI driving unemployment?",
      "content": "Nor are rising levels of graduate and youth unemployment the smoking gun that some believe. Unfortunately, young people are always the first to feel any weakening in the job market. When things start to cool, employers cut hiring first, hitting younger workers, while existing, older employees sit tight. Rates of youth unemployment are far more volatile than rates of unemployment for older workers.\n\nSo even the squeeze on tech jobs and younger workers, which at first sight looks like clear-cut evidence of the impact of AI, can be explained by more prosaic factors – the surge in business costs, a sharp rise in interest rates and the equity sell-off. [...] Technology is one factor that drives the endless process of job creation and destruction, but so, too, is the economic cycle, innovation, competition, regulation and much more. The current downturn in the labour market has much more to do with the familiar, cyclical suspects, such as interest rates and inflation, than AI.\n\nAI could reshape the world of work. So far it is doing so in an undramatic fashion. A recent study by the Yale Budget Lab found that the rate of change in the mix of US jobs since the launch of ChatGPT has not been markedly different than that seen after the advent of the personal computer in the 1980s or the internet in the 1990s. Not so much a case of ‘this time it’s different’ as ‘this time it’s the same’.\n\n### Stay up to date [...] It would be surprising if AI did not destroy some jobs. Most transformational technologies do. There’s never a time when some technology or innovation wasn’t reshaping work and destroying jobs. But technology also creates new types of work, and, by raising productivity and demand, fuels job growth elsewhere in the economy. Decades of rapid technological change have been accompanied by growing, not falling, employment. The number of US jobs has risen sixfold since 1900 while, in recent years, unemployment has run at exceptionally low levels.",
      "score": 0.06206344,
      "raw_content": null
    },

      "url": "https://www.databricks.com/blog/infrastructure-strategies-driving-next-wave-enterprise-ai",
      "title": "Infrastructure & Strategies Driving the Next Wave of ...",
      "content": "Enterprises that have started this transition are treating agentic capabilities as catalysts for discipline. Workday, for example, focuses heavily on surfacing the right data to agents, validating the authority behind agent actions, and ensuring governance patterns are consistent at every layer. Their approach reinforces that responsible autonomy is achievable only when data strategy and AI strategy move together.\n\n3M offers another perspective. Their data and AI teams concentrate on building deeper metadata and business context before scaling agentic capabilities. By strengthening the semantic layer behind their data, they ensure that every model and agent has the clarity it needs to make dependable decisions. For them, context is not a technical detai, buta strategic asset. [...] As executives plan for the next decade of AI innovation, the real question is no longer whether AI will transform their business. It is whether their organization’s data, governance, and architectural foundations are prepared to support autonomy, action, and long-term performance.\n\n## Where to Go Deeper\n\nDownload the full MIT Technology Review for detailed insights into the practices that separate high-performing data and AI organizations from their peers.\n\nWatch the on-demand webinar: Unlocking the Future of Data and AI, to learn how leaders from 3M, Workday, Reckitt, and Databricks are aligning data, governance, and AI to deliver real outcomes.\n\nKeep up with us\n\nShare this post\n\n## Never miss a Databricks post\n\n## Sign up\n\n## What's next? [...] AI has advanced quickly, yet only a small group of enterprises are converting early wins into meaningful advantage. Most have proven that generative AI can boost productivity and accelerate workflows, but far fewer have built the foundations required to scale that impact across the business. The moment facing senior technology leaders is decisive. The differentiator is no longer progress alone, but whether data, governance, and architecture are mature enough to translate AI momentum into enterprise-wide performance.",

      "content": "Enterprises that have started this transition are treating agentic capabilities as catalysts for discipline. Workday, for example, focuses heavily on surfacing the right data to agents, validating the authority behind agent actions, and ensuring governance patterns are consistent at every layer. Their approach reinforces that responsible autonomy is achievable only when data strategy and AI strategy move together.\n\n3M offers another perspective. Their data and AI teams concentrate on building deeper metadata and business context before scaling agentic capabilities. By strengthening the semantic layer behind their data, they ensure that every model and agent has the clarity it needs to make dependable decisions. For them, context is not a technical detai, buta strategic asset.       "content": "Enterprises that have started this transition are treating agentic capabilities as catalysts for discipline. Workday, for example, focuses heavily on surfacing the right data to agents, validating the authority behind agent actions, and ensuring governance patterns are consistent at every layer. Their approach reinforces that responsible autonomy is achievable only when data strategy and AI strategy move together.\n\n3M offers another perspective. Their data and AI teams concentrate on building deeper metadata and business context before scaling agentic capabilities. By strengthening the semantic layer behind their data, they ensure that every model and agent has the clarity it needs to make dependable decisions. For them, context is not a technical detai, buta strategic asset.     {
      "url": "https://www.deloitte.com/ce/en/industries/technology/analysis/ai-infrastructure-compute-strategy.html",
      "title": "AI inference is reshaping enterprise compute strategies",
      "content": "“The infrastructure many enterprises have today was designed for the pre-AI era. No one is that smart or lucky to have designed their architecture for something that didn’t exist at the time. Very quickly, most infrastructure capacity will be dedicated to AI systems rather than traditional workloads.”\n\nThis shift is accelerating the emergence of so-called “AI factories” – purpose-built environments that integrate AI-optimized hardware, high-performance networking, data pipelines and unified orchestration platforms. These environments are designed to support multimodal AI workloads efficiently, reduce architectural risk and enable faster deployment at scale.\n\nWorkforce transformation and sustainability come to the fore [...] Beyond cost pressures, enterprises must also navigate data sovereignty requirements, latency constraints, intellectual property protection and system resilience. According to Deloitte Insights, the answer is not a binary choice between cloud and on-premises infrastructure, but a more deliberate, workload-driven hybrid approach that aligns technical requirements with business priorities.\n\nOrganizations that act now to modernize infrastructure and build workforce capabilities are better positioned to shape the next phase of enterprise computing. Advances in specialized chipsets, high-speed networking and intelligent workload orchestration are becoming foundational to AI at scale.\n\nHybrid compute becomes a strategic imperative [...] © 2026.     {
      "url": "http://mckinsey.com/capabilities/tech-and-ai/our-insights/superagency-in-the-workplace-empowering-people-to-unlock-ais-full-potential-at-work",
      "title": "AI in the workplace: A report for 2025 | McKinsey",
      "content": "19 hours ago",
      "score": 0.074966356,
      "raw_content": null

    {
      "url": "https://www.deloitte.com/uk/en/blogs/monday-briefing/is-ai-driving-unemployment.html",
      "title": "Is AI driving unemployment?",
      "content": "Nor are rising levels of graduate and youth unemployment the smoking gun that some believe. Unfortunately, young people are always the first to feel any weakening in the job market. When things start to cool, employers cut hiring first, hitting younger workers, while existing, older employees sit tight. Rates of youth unemployment are far more volatile than rates of unemployment for older workers.\n\nSo even the squeeze on tech jobs and younger workers, which at first sight looks like clear-cut evidence of the impact of AI, can be explained by more prosaic factors – the surge in business costs, a sharp rise in interest rates and the equity sell-off. [...] Technology is one factor that drives the endless process of job creation and destruction, but so, too, is the economic cycle, innovation, competition, regulation and much more. The current downturn in the labour market has much more to do with the familiar, cyclical suspects, such as interest rates and inflation, than AI.\n\nAI could reshape the world of work. So far it is doing so in an undramatic fashion. A recent study by the Yale Budget Lab found that the rate of change in the mix of US jobs since the launch of ChatGPT has not been markedly different than that seen after the advent of the personal computer in the 1980s or the internet in the 1990s. Not so much a case of ‘this time it’s different’ as ‘this time it’s the same’.\n\n### Stay up to date [...] It would be surprising if AI did not destroy some jobs. Most transformational technologies do. There’s never a time when some technology or innovation wasn’t reshaping work and destroying jobs. But technology also creates new types of work, and, by raising productivity and demand, fuels job growth elsewhere in the economy. Decades of rapid technological change have been accompanied by growing, not falling, employment. The number of US jobs has risen sixfold since 1900 while, in recent years, unemployment has run at exceptionally low levels.",
      "score": 0.061995264,
      "raw_content": null
    },

Our commitment here is a reflection of our core values, including a focus on our employees, customer service, innovation, and integrity. [...] 2024 report Global Study Closing the AI trust gap Closing the AI Trust Gap | 2 Introduction At Workday, we believe successfully unlocking human potential with AI is only possible with a foundation of trust. The future of work starts here— with trust at the center.\nAs a values-driven organization, we’ve prioritized trust since day one. Security and protection are our top priorities when it comes to our customers’ critical data. Today, we’re committed to taking an equally trust-centric approach with Workday AI. [...] “ We know how these technologies can benefit economic opportunities for people—that’s our business. But people won’t use technologies they don’t trust. Morse VP, Public Policy, Workday More from this expert Our vision for AI and the future of work.\n• We develop AI technologies to amplify human potential for positive societal impact.\n• We follow a robust responsible AI framework, ensuring a deep understanding of where human intervention is needed.\n• We champion transparency and fairness and deliver on our commitment to data privacy and protection.",

    {
      "url": "https://www.databricks.com/blog/infrastructure-strategies-driving-next-wave-enterprise-ai",
      "title": "Infrastructure & Strategies Driving the Next Wave of ...",
      "content": "Enterprises that have started this transition are treating agentic capabilities as catalysts for discipline. Workday, for example, focuses heavily on surfacing the right data to agents, validating the authority behind agent actions, and ensuring governance patterns are consistent at every layer. Their approach reinforces that responsible autonomy is achievable only when data strategy and AI strategy move together.\n\n3M offers another perspective. Their data and AI teams concentrate on building deeper metadata and business context before scaling agentic capabilities. By strengthening the semantic layer behind their data, they ensure that every model and agent has the clarity it needs to make dependable decisions. For them, context is not a technical detai, buta strategic asset. [...] As executives plan for the next decade of AI innovation, the real question is no longer whether AI will transform their business. It is whether their organization’s data, governance, and architectural foundations are prepared to support autonomy, action, and long-term performance.\n\n## Where to Go Deeper\n\nDownload the full MIT Technology Review for detailed insights into the practices that separate high-performing data and AI organizations from their peers.\n\nWatch the on-demand webinar: Unlocking the Future of Data and AI, to learn how leaders from 3M, Workday, Reckitt, and Databricks are aligning data, governance, and AI to deliver real outcomes.\n\nKeep up with us\n\nShare this post\n\n## Never miss a Databricks post\n\n## Sign up\n\n## What's next? [...] AI has advanced quickly, yet only a small group of enterprises are converting early wins into meaningful advantage. Most have proven that generative AI can boost productivity and accelerate workflows, but far fewer have built the foundations required to scale that impact across the business. The moment facing senior technology leaders is decisive. The differentiator is no longer progress alone, but whether data, governance, and architecture are mature enough to translate AI momentum into enterprise-wide performance.",
      "score": 0.57637566,
      "raw_content": null
    },
    {
      "url": "https://www.databricks.com/de/blog/infrastructure-strategies-driving-next-wave-enterprise-ai",
      "title": "Infrastruktur & Strategien für die nächste Welle der ...",
      "content": "Unternehmen, die diesen Übergang gestartet haben, behandeln agentenbasierte Fähigkeiten als Katalysatoren für Disziplin. Workday zum Beispiel konzentriert sich stark darauf, den Agenten die richtigen Daten bereitzustellen, die Autorität hinter den Aktionen der Agenten zu validieren und sicherzustellen, dass die Governance-Muster auf jeder Ebene konsistent sind. Ihr Ansatz unterstreicht, dass verantwortungsvolle Autonomie nur dann erreichbar ist, wenn Datenstrategie und KI-Strategie Hand in Hand gehen. [...] Wenn Führungskräfte für das nächste Jahrzehnt der KI-Innovation planen, ist die eigentliche Frage nicht mehr, ob KI ihr Unternehmen transformieren wird. Sondern vielmehr, ob die Data Governance- und Architektur-Grundlagen ihrer Organisation bereit sind, Autonomie, Handlungsfähigkeit und langfristige Performance zu unterstützen.\n\n## Vertiefende Informationen\n\nLaden Sie den vollständigen MIT Technology Review herunter und erhalten Sie detaillierte Einblicke in die Methoden, die leistungsstarke Daten- und KI-Organisationen von anderen unterscheiden.\n\nSehen Sie sich das On-Demand-Webinar an: Die Zukunft von Daten und KI erschließen, um zu erfahren, wie Führungskräfte von 3M, Workday, Reckitt und Databricks Daten, Governance und KI aufeinander abstimmen, um echte Ergebnisse zu erzielen. [...] Die KI hat sich schnell weiterentwickelt, doch nur eine kleine Gruppe von Unternehmen wandelt frühe Erfolge in einen spürbaren Vorteil um. Die meisten haben bewiesen, dass generative KI die Produktivität steigern und Arbeitsabläufe beschleunigen kann, aber weitaus weniger haben die erforderlichen Grundlagen geschaffen, um diese Wirkung im gesamten Unternehmen zu skalieren. Für leitende Technologieführungskräfte ist dies ein entscheidender Moment. Das Unterscheidungsmerkmal ist nicht mehr nur der Fortschritt allein, sondern ob Daten, Data Governance und Architektur ausgereift genug sind, um die KI-Dynamik in unternehmensweite Performance umzusetzen.",

      "url": "https://www.deloitte.com/ce/en/industries/technology/analysis/ai-infrastructure-compute-strategy.html",
      "title": "AI inference is reshaping enterprise compute strategies",
      "content": "“The infrastructure many enterprises have today was designed for the pre-AI era. No one is that smart or lucky to have designed their architecture for something that didn’t exist at the time. Very quickly, most infrastructure capacity will be dedicated to AI systems rather than traditional workloads.”\n\nThis shift is accelerating the emergence of so-called “AI factories” – purpose-built environments that integrate AI-optimized hardware, high-performance networking, data pipelines and unified orchestration platforms. These environments are designed to support multimodal AI workloads efficiently, reduce architectural risk and enable faster deployment at scale.\n\nWorkforce transformation and sustainability come to the fore [...] Beyond cost pressures, enterprises must also navigate data sovereignty requirements, latency constraints, intellectual property protection and system resilience. According to Deloitte Insights, the answer is not a binary choice between cloud and on-premises infrastructure, but a more deliberate, workload-driven hybrid approach that aligns technical requirements with business priorities.\n\nOrganizations that act now to modernize infrastructure and build workforce capabilities are better positioned to shape the next phase of enterprise computing. Advances in specialized chipsets, high-speed networking and intelligent workload orchestration are becoming foundational to AI at scale.\n\nHybrid compute becomes a strategic imperative [...] © 2026.     {
      "url": "https://www.deloitte.com/uk/en/blogs/monday-briefing/is-ai-driving-unemployment.html",
      "title": "Is AI driving unemployment?",
      "content": "Nor are rising levels of graduate and youth unemployment the smoking gun that some believe. Unfortunately, young people are always the first to feel any weakening in the job market. When things start to cool, employers cut hiring first, hitting younger workers, while existing, older employees sit tight. Rates of youth unemployment are far more volatile than rates of unemployment for older workers.\n\nSo even the squeeze on tech jobs and younger workers, which at first sight looks like clear-cut evidence of the impact of AI, can be explained by more prosaic factors – the surge in business costs, a sharp rise in interest rates and the equity sell-off. [...] Technology is one factor that drives the endless process of job creation and destruction, but so, too, is the economic cycle, innovation, competition, regulation and much more. The current downturn in the labour market has much more to do with the familiar, cyclical suspects, such as interest rates and inflation, than AI.\n\nAI could reshape the world of work. So far it is doing so in an undramatic fashion. A recent study by the Yale Budget Lab found that the rate of change in the mix of US jobs since the launch of ChatGPT has not been markedly different than that seen after the advent of the personal computer in the 1980s or the internet in the 1990s. Not so much a case of ‘this time it’s different’ as ‘this time it’s the same’.\n\n### Stay up to date [...] It would be surprising if AI did not destroy some jobs. Most transformational technologies do. There’s never a time when some technology or innovation wasn’t reshaping work and destroying jobs. But technology also creates new types of work, and, by raising productivity and demand, fuels job growth elsewhere in the economy. Decades of rapid technological change have been accompanied by growing, not falling, employment. The number of US jobs has risen sixfold since 1900 while, in recent years, unemployment has run at exceptionally low levels.",
      "score": 0.06206344,
      "raw_content": null
    },
